string.text: Anti-radiation drugs

Mexaminum radiation protection drugs are common in the Zone. When used, this drug induces contraction of peripheral blood vessels and oxygen deprivation, which serves to treat and prevent radiation exposure. The drug does not have severe side effects, although isolated cases of mild nausea, dizziness, cramps and stomach pain have been reported.

Bandage

A normal elastic bandage used to stop bleeding and prevent infection of wounds. For regular bleeding, carefully apply the bandage to the wound. For arterial bleeding, urgently tie the bandage around the affected area.

Standard Ukrainian issue military binoculars with a maximum of x7.5 magnification. Useful in the Zone in that they allow its owner to observe things from a distance. Very durable.
Military Binoculars
Bread Loaf

A fine bread loaf baked by Nimble's wife who lives outside the Zone. This was the first item Nimble started to sell before his business expanded. Nowadays, he provides barkeepers with this fine bread instead of selling it himself as in the past, after all he has a company to manage.

Russian PLAYBOY

100 pages worth of prime nude Russian girls. Probably the best way to travel to a better place, at least mentally. Westerners often joke about it saying "From Russia with love".

Pack of Marlboro cigarettes (imported)

Pack of cigarettes imported from the West. Someone must have smoked most of them since there are only a few left. Smoking just one may stabilize your mental state and lets you satisfy hunger a bit. They are rare in the Zone and quite valuable.

Ukrainian Special Forces Survival Guide

You have studied this survival guide many times before. For this reason it does not have any educational value, but you should be able to sell it for some quick cash. Some Stalkers may want to take a look at it.

This bar provides the body with necessary proteins and sugars which give you a welcome boost. Useful on longer trips when you're on the go and need to eat something fast.

Axyltallisal "The Rebirth"

Warning! Do not use in combination with any other drug as this may prove lethal. This powerful mixture contained in a small syringe will make you lose consciousness. But when you wake up (if you wake up), you will feel reborn. Inject the syringe into your thigh when sitting down.

"Abakan" beef tushonka (imported)

Tushonka is a common name of canned, stewed meat produced in the Soviet Union and other Warsaw Pact countries. The irony is that the idea originally came to Russia in a form of World War II aid transports from the United States. Since then, various kinds of tushonkas have become a primary means of long-time meat preservation, used both by the civilian population and as a standard-issue Red Army food ration. It's worth mentioning that despite their long expiry date, tushonkas are known for their high nutrition value (mostly owing to high fat content) and a relatively good taste. The Chernobyl Exclusion Zone has seen hundreds of types and tastes of tushonkas. In the spring of 2013 'Abakan' minced meat brand remains the unquestionable king and certainly the Zone has seen worse than that.

2 small skewered tushkanos, grilled and seasoned with salt and chilli pepper. The cheapest hot meal that is cooked in the the Zone. Wrapped in thick brown paper to prevent the fat from dripping.

Grilled snork hand, ready to be eaten. WARNING: Most Zoners consider eating snork's meat to be cannibalistic and immoral. However, certain factions, such as bandits and mercenaries, include it in their meals so as to show their superiority over other groups.

Echo detector

This dated anomalous activity detector produces an alarm signal when anomalous particles enter a special chamber as you approach an anomaly. It can also register the presence of artifacts and measure the distance to the nearest one. The distance is indicated by the frequency of the sound the detector emits. To switch to artifact search mode, open the device's front cover. Due to its simple design, Echo can only be used to locate the most common artifacts.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]PROPERTIES:
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] technological item
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] does not require UPD
Detector "Bear"
Veles detector

A next generation scientific detection scanner. Thanks to three modernized detection chambers, the position of artifacts is shown on a special display screen. When closed, the device registers only radiation and anomalies. To switch to artifact search mode, open the front LED display. When in search mode, the detector is capable of locating all artifacts known to science.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]PROPERTIES:
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] technological item
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] does not require UPD
Svarog detector prototype

A prototype of an expanded functionality anomalous frequency scanner. This device comes with a program used to identify static areas of anomalous activity stored in its database, while retaining the ability to locate artifacts. The position of anomalous areas and artifacts is displayed on a special screen. The artifact search mode, which can be activated by opening the front LED display, has been modified to detect anomalous formations currently unknown to science.

A standard head-mounted flashlight in fully working order. Useful for stalkers who find themselves out and about after dark, but may attract trouble if used unwisely.

Head lamp
Anabiotics (Zone-produced)
Antidote (imported)

The IP2 antitoxin is a complex drug comprising several antidotes, including metoclopramidum, pyridoxine, thiamine, riboxin and other pharmaceuticals. The drug is used to inject a range of antibiotics to neutralize natural poisons, together with synthetic poison absorbers, into the bloodstream. IP2 is not particularly popular in the Zone as most stalkers rely on a gas mask and a protective suit. However, there are still those who have a few units of this antidote stashed for emergency situations. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

Hercules (imported)
Vinca (imported)

Ukrainian Vikasolum - an artificial equivalent of vitamin K. The main purpose of this drug is to increase blood coagulation speed. In great demand among stalkers who want slow-healing wounds and lacerations inflicted by mutants to close up faster. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

Psy-block (imported)

A drug that blocks avalanche-like nerve impulses. Consumption induces short-term loss of all emotion. Used exclusively in the Zone to counteract the effects of anomalous psy-fields. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

'The Beak' (Zone-produced)

'The Beak' is a powerful mixture of Zone-produced vodka and the pulverized beak of a black crow. Not every beak can be used as an ingredient, only the one that belonged to a black male Zone crow that has lived for more than 15 years as the beak has mutated and hardened. The rumor has it that such beaks contain a form of enriched protein that cleanses moderate amounts of radiation from the body. Some even say that taking the Beak shot makes you feel like you have wings for a few seconds. On the downside, however, the taste itself it said to be awful.
Strong energy drink (imported)

Often used by Stalkers on long trips due to its exhilarating effect when you're tired. The drink also sobers you up a bit if you're drunk as well as induces the release of adrenaline into the bloodstream. Do not overdose.

Army medkit

A specialized medical kit for providing first aid to combat casualties. The kit includes blood coagulants based on menadione, painkillers, antibiotics and immunostimulants, as well as a kit for removing bullets and fragments from the body. This medkit is issued primarily to army personnel such as Spetsnaz units embedded deep within the Zone and is popular among Duty forces.

Scientific medkit

A medical kit designed specifically for use in the Zone. The kit contains products for handling wounds, as well as preventing the development of radiation poisoning: and reducing accumulated radiation in the body. Contains Vikasolum, Batilolum and Naphazoline, unlike other medkits.

Small glucose shot (imported)

Glucose shots are used in cases of severe diabetic hypoglycemia, but can also be employed as a stimulant. Instant induction of carbohydrates entails a rapid boost of energy, thus allowing the user to undertake increased physical effort and withstand stress. Due to its convenient means of administration they can be used in combat situations. This makes glucose shot a very good way to speed-up healing process.

Improvised stimpack (Zone-produced)

Improvised stimpacks are popular among novice Zoners as they are easy to obtain and inexpensive. Produced in the Zone from commonly available ingredients, without proper equipment and purification. This is the cause of many side effects which include headache, paraesthesia and considerable increase in nutrition demand. Injected in the thigh.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]PROPERTIES:

Military stimpack (imported)

Military stims constitute a part of standard-issue soldier equipment for field operations in the Zone. Easily available on the market and can be acquired for a moderate price. Popular among experienced Stalkers. They are significantly more potent and faster working than their improvised counterparts, which makes them perfect for use in life-threatening situations. Produced from raw agents of high density which can take their toll on the body. Side effects include shock, extreme dizziness and increased hunger.

Scientific stimpack (imported)

Created by the same Department of Chemistry in Kiev which developed the well-known SEVA suit, this state-of-the-art solution constitutes the most potent health stabilizer available in the Zone. Best quality ingredients and perfected formula enable almost instant recuperation and radiation cleansing. Side effects are minimized. Extremely high cost practically limits the target group of specific to most skillful and successful Stalkers.

Nemiroff Vodka (imported)

Nemiroff is a Ukrainian producer of alcoholic beverages, specializing in vodkas and other spirits, based in the town of Nemyrivin the Vinnytska oblast. One of the best vodkas in the world and – by extension – in the Zone.

Putinka Vodka (imported)

Following the tradition of naming vodka brands after Russian leaders, Putinka first went into production after Vladimir Putin was elected president. Produced in Russia from the finest grain and crystal clear water from Siberian springs. Triple purification, smooth texture, unique taste are not the only characteristics of this beverage. Drink with moderation.

This last generation anomalous activity detector can be used to locate anomalous formations and has a color diode panel, which not only indicates the direction of artifacts, but also measures the distance to them. To switch to artifact search mode, open the device's front cover. Unfortunately, the device is programmed with a somewhat outdated list of detectable artifacts.
 
%c[0,140,140,140]PROPERTIES:

An experimental drug developed by Professor Ozersky for scientific research teams working in the Zone. At its core, the drug contains tetrodotoxin, known colloquially as "zombie powder," which causes a complete shutdown of the body's central nervous system that may allow people to survive emissions outside cover. The drug has not undergone clinical or field testing, which puts its effectiveness in doubt and raises the issue of possible side effects.
 
%c[0,153,255,255] • %c[0,140,140,140] medicine
%c[0,204,0,51] • %c[0,140,140,140] causes temporary blackout
Bolt

The main component of this product is an anabolic androgen, an artificial steroid, the chemical composition of which resembles testosterone. Often used by stalkers during long raids to reduce muscle fatigue. Significantly increases weight-carrying capacity. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

B190 Indraline radioprotectant, included in medkits issued to nuclear power plant personnel. Used in the Zone instead of the excessively toxic PC1 cysteamine hydrochloride, repeated use of which often caused death. Reduces the effects of gamma radiation on live tissue. Best consumed before exposure, as effects are not instant. The effects of the drug are long-lasting.

Battery pack

A pack of batteries. Someone must have used them since they are already half drained. Intended for use in your flashlight, PDA, nightvision goggles and other electronic devices. Remember to change regularly.

Beards tea (Zone-produced)

Beard's popular hot tea made from a mixture of sugar, edible dried mushrooms and boiled water that is said to be radiation-free. Stalkers who can afford to buy the drink often take it for long trips in the Zone. It's a good and healthy way to stay on your toes when you're getting tired or when you're out exploring in cold nights.

Steel wool

Steel wool, also known as wire wool or wire sponge, is a bundle of strands of very fine soft steel filaments. It is used as an abrasive in finishing and repair work for polishing wood or metal objects, cleaning household cookware, and sanding in light painting. Steel wool is made from low-carbon steel (low enough to be close to plain iron). It is not made by drawing "steel wool wire" through a tapered die, but rather by a process more like broaching where a heavy steel wire is pulled through a toothed die that removes a thin wire shaving. Bundles of steel wool can be used in precision equipment cleaning and to improve spreading of lubricants and cleaning solvents.

Industrial grease

Grease is a semisolid lubricant. It generally consists of a soap emulsified with mineral or vegetable oil. It is applied to mechanisms that can only be lubricated infrequently and where a lubricating oil would not stay in position. They also act as sealants to prevent ingress of water and incompressible materials. Grease-lubricated bearings have greater frictional characteristics due to their high viscosity.

"Brunox Gun Care" spray lubricant

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] suited for all weapons
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Spray can containing oil intended for lubricating and protecting firearms. Frequent application will prevent guns from malfunctioning and corroding, especially after prolonged use in combat situations. Prior to lubrication process, it is advisable to properly clean the firearm to remove any foreign material that has accumulated on or inside it. One can also make use of basic tools in order to access the inner parts of a gun so as to maximize the effectiveness of maintenance. A special tuboline increases the gliding quality of all movable parts making the oil even better suited for repeaters and automatic weapons. This allows guns to function even at temperatures of up to -55 °C. It has a flash point of 78°C.

"Dvojka" gun oil and cleaning solvent

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] suited for all weapons
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Iconic Red Army oil that has been in service for almost 70 years. The metal bottle is divided into two separate compartments, one for oil and the other one for the cleaning solvent. It was used extensively in World War II and could be found in standard-issue Mosin-Nagant's buttstock containers. At that time, the solvent was based on an alcaline solution for effective clean-up of preservation salts in which ammunition was commonly shipped and stored. Since then the composition of liquids has been modernized many times, but the simple yet ingenious 'double' bottle design remained unchanged. "Dvojka" is very popular in the Exclusion Zone due to its versatility. Bear in mind, however, that the liquids require adequate tools to be spread properly and so that it can reach deep into weapon's inner mechanisms. “Dvojka” should thus be regarded as more of an addon than a stand-alone maintenance item.

Hoppe's "No. 9" cleaning solvent

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] suited for all weapons
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Western-made, high-quality firearm cleaning solvent, especially adapted for use in harsh environmental conditions, the Hoppe's #9 Bore Cleaning remains perhaps the most commonly used solution. Like all cleaning solvents, it is designed for preventing rust and removing powder, lead and metal fouling, but its unique property is that it makes heavy particles less likely to stick to mechanical parts of a firearm. This proves especially useful in the irradiated Zone. Substance acts quickly, is super-efficient, safe and easy to use. Although it flows freely and penetrates rapidly, it is still advisable to use tools or fabrics to increase spread. Due to the high quality and relative rarity, its price on the Zone's equipment maintenance market is quite high.

Handgun repair kit

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] suited for 9mm, .45 and .357 caliber weapons
 
%c[0,170,170,170]This kit contains oils, solvents, basic cleaning equipment and specialized tools used for weapon disassembly and mechanisms maintenance. It also by standard comes with set of elementary firearm spare parts. In short - all that is needed to restore usability of a firearm provided you possess necessary knowledge of weapon mechanics and construction. Because of its content the kit is quite heavy, but is irreplaceable when venturing deep into the Zone as it can be used in life-or-death situations to make a firearm usable again. Due to differences in weapon construction this particular set can only be used for disassembly and repair of weapons with handgun calibers. It's also possible to additionally enhance the effect of the kit by borrowing certain materials from or combining with other kits during a single maintenance session.

Basic sewing kit

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] all outfit and light headgear sets
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Light sewing kit consisting of a cloth reel, several steel needles and a pair of scissors. It can be used to sew up bullet holes or ruptures in soft fabrics of outfits. Its practical applications are limited due to the length of thread and subpar durability of needles, so the kit will be useless in case of more serious damage. For the same reason, it's compatible with only a handful of materials. Nonetheless, it is strongly advised to always use whatever is available to make the kit more effective.

%c[0,170,170,170]This military-grade, heavy sewing kit is designed to handle fractures in protective plates of modern combat armors. It contains enough metallic thread to put together outfits that have literally been torn apart. Capable of sewing on even hardest of mutant hides to your armor of choice. Another advantage of the kit are the basic mechanical tools that can be used to disassemble outfits and headgear in order to salvage repair materials. It's the highest quality sewing kit available in the Zone.

'Zviezda' glue tube (basic glue)

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] all outfit and light headgear sets
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Cheapest of the synthetic adhesives available in the Zone, this epoxy-based solution may be used to put together two slightly torn pieces of fabric or to patch up a small hole on top of your helmet, but it will be useless in case of any serious damage. On the other hand, 'Zviezda' has a great value for price, and if used on a regular basis it's able to keep your outfit in a good shape at all times. It is advised to use any type of commonly found materials to greatly increase effectiveness of repair. The glue, however, won't support mutant skins. Can also be used to facilitate sewing.

%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] all outfit and headgear sets
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Advanced glue produced by Ukrainian chemical industry, modified epoxy-based adhesive 'Tur' is able to quickly bind most solid materials. Versatility and ease of use are the two reasons why 'Tur' is kept in such a high regard among Stalkers, especially since spare materials are scarce. The glue binds both textile fabrics and lighter protective materials like kevlar, but is useless when it comes to metals.

'M17' glue tube (extreme glue)

%c[0,140,140,140]COMPATIBILITY:
 
%c[255,238,153,26] • %c[0,140,140,140] all outfit and headgear sets
 
%c[0,170,170,170]M17 is a result of a Soviet military-industrial research project to devise an extremely potent, single-ingredient adhesive which could be used in any situation regardless of purpose and materials involved. It was decided to use a highly potent methacrylate which is most often optimized for reacting with either plastic or metal. In case of M17, however, this limitation has been bypassed, making the substance equally effective in both areas. In addition, the adhesive received a significant boost to versatility thanks to its hydrate form: it can be diluted with water and used in any concentration depending on intended result. There is almost no damage that the glue, combined with appropriate materials, won't be able to repair. Can be used with all materials available in the Zone.

%c[0,170,170,170]A repair set allowing the user to perform emergency repairs of outfits. Includes military grade ducktape and ready-to-use sheets of thick textile in a variety of shapes and sizes which make possible to quickly patch up any outfit damage. This is especially useful to prevent further structural damage of already damaged suits. Due to relative low durability of provided materials, the kit can be used only for minor repairs and is ineffective in case of harder materials like kevlar or metal. For this reason, the kit has very limited use in headgear maintenance.

Clear Sky faction patch

Faction patches are often used to determine the rank of faction members, and the reasoning behind it is simple: the higher the count, the better the skills. For this reason, it can be extremely dangerous to display the patch to the wrong people, but it can as well open important doors for you.

Purified water (Zone-produced)

Military flasks are intended for taking small sips of water. Prepared by medics and scientist. First, the water – combined with a special type of alcohol – is boiled at a very high temperature for purification and disinfection. Afterwards, it is cooled in refrigerators, to which it owes its refreshing “spark.” The end result is water that is completely radiation-free. If regardless of the above, you still have doubts concerning its purity, you can always use akvatab. Due to the cost of the production process, military flasks are in a limited supply and are offered to each Stalker at a moderate price. Medics also have them in stock, but they're slightly more expensive as they include the cost of transportation.

Mein Kampf

Heil Hitler! Adolf Hitler's strategic memoires collected in a single book. The book and all that it stands for is hated by many, which makes this an item hold high symbolic value. Adolf Hitler (20 April 1889 – 30 April 1945) was an Austrian-born German politician and the leader of the National Socialist German Workers Party (German: Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiterpartei (NSDAP), commonly referred to as the Nazi Party). He was chancellor of Germany from 1933 to 1945 and dictator of Nazi Germany (as Führer und Reichskanzler) from 1934 to 1945. Hitler was at the centre of the founding of Nazism, the start of World War II, and the Holocaust.

Dead Geiger Counter

Dead Geiger counter that has served its purpose. A Geiger counter is a type of particle detector that measures ionizing radiation. It detects the emission of – alpha particles, beta particles or gamma rays – radiation by ionization produced in a low-pressure gas in a tube. Invented in 1908, Geiger counters remain popular instruments used for measurements in health, physics, industry, geology and other fields because they can be made with simple electronic circuits.

Drug distribution notes

This notebook describes various drug deals in detail. Specific nicknames, locations and time of meets. Some deals are executed through equipment exchanges and others are paid in large amounts of roubles. When browsing the pages, it becomes clear that Freedom is the main distributor of natural drugs such as marijuana. Bandits are producers and distributors of the more powerful (and dangerous) synthetic drugs like salicylic acid and cocaine. Apparently, every faction in the Zone takes part in these deals. Especially Monolith seems to be taking in large amounts drugs in exchange for more expensive types of ammunition and equipment.

It's not safe to sleep!
Quick Release System

Being caught by surprise in the Zone is one of the worst things that can happen to you. Although QR-system does not help you prevent such situations, it certainly helps with getting out of danger. Its function is simple: it removes the straps from your backpack almost immediately and lets you escape to a safe place without the heavy backpack hampering your movement. To use it, set it as a hotkey item. Push the hotkey to activate the emergency release that instantly drops your backpack (and everything inside it). Your equipped weapon(s), ammunition, armour and armour attachments remain equipped so you are ready to fight. You can retrieve your backpack afterwards.

Cocaine (Zone produced)

Small aluminium case containing cocaine and the tools facilitating use. Cocaine is a powerful nervous system stimulant. Its effects can last from 15–30 minutes to an hour, depending on the route of administration. Cocaine increases alertness, feelings of well-being and euphoria, energy and motor activity, feelings of competence and sexuality. Athletic performance may be enhanced in sports where sustained attention and endurance is required. Anxiety, paranoia and restlessness are also frequent. With excessive dosage, tremors, convulsions and increased body temperature are observed. Bandits are known for sniffing this drug right before launching an assault or ambush.

Tetanus vaccine (imported)

Tetanus vaccine is composed of inactivated tetanus toxin and is used to prevent an individual from contracting tetanus. Tetanus, also known as lockjaw, is a disease caused by the bacteria Clostridium tetani which enter the body through open wounds and releases a poison called tetanospasmin. This is a potentially deadly disease because the poison attacks the nervous system blocking nerve signals from the spinal cord to and from the muscles. Animals of the Zone and mutants alike are prone to carry Clostridium tetani which can be transferred through bites. Injection of inactivated toxin enhances your immunological system and can lead to several positive side-effects. Moreover, this vaccine has been supplemented by several additional anti-toxins making it usable for purposes other than preventing contraction of tetanus.

Camouflaged tarpaulin

A tarpaulin (or hootch) is a large sheet of strong, flexible, water-resistant or waterproof material, often cloth such as canvas or polyester coated with urethane, or made of plastics such as polyethylene. It often has reinforced grommets at the corners and along the sides to form attachment points for rope, allowing them to be tied down or suspended. Serves many purposes. It is mainly used to create small and simple tent-like hideouts. Trading value is low due to easily found alternatives.

Epinephrine shot (imported)

Epinephrine (also known as adrenalin) is a hormone and a neurotransmitter. Epinephrine has many functions in the body, instantly regulating heart rate, blood vessel and air passage diameters, and metabolic shifts. Epinephrine release is a crucial component of the fight-or-flight response of the sympathetic nervous system. The effects lead to increased blood glucose and fatty acids, providing substrates for instant energy production within cells throughout the body.

Hexamine field cooker

A lightweight, strong and compact solid fuel stove supplied with two small Hexene fuel tabs. Hexi solid fuel tablets burn without odour and ignite easily with a match - 4 small fuel tablets will bring to the boil 2.5 cups of water in approximately 5 minutes. The cooker can be used in several ways. The hinged openers can be angled to concentrate the heat to a pinpointed area, for direct heat, or used at 90 degree angle for regular cooking, or the cooker can be inverted (spikes down) placing the fuel blocks closer to the mess tin. Whichever way you use it, hexi cooker is a reliable field cooker that will never let you down. It will work in all weathers, and heat water and food quickly.

It's not safe to sleep!
Quick Release System

Being caught by surprise in the Zone is one of the worst things that can happen to you. Although QR-system does not help you prevent such situations, it certainly helps with getting out of danger. Its function is simple: it removes the straps from your backpack almost immediately and lets you escape to a safe place without the heavy backpack hampering your movement. To use it, set it as a hotkey item. Push the hotkey to activate the emergency release that instantly drops your backpack (and everything inside it). Your equipped weapon(s), ammunition, armour and armour attachments remain equipped so you are ready for fighting. You can retrieve your backpack afterwards.

Morphine ampoule (imported)

An iron ampoule designed as field equipment for military field personnel for instant pain reduction. This ampoule contains a powerful dose of morphine. In clinical medicine, morphine is regarded as the gold standard of opioid analgesics used to relieve severe or agonizing pain and suffering. Like other opioids, such as oxycodone, hydromorphone, and diacetylmorphine (heroin), morphine acts directly on the central nervous system (CNS) to relieve pain. Injected into an arm or a thigh.

Salicidic Acid ampoule (imported)

An iron ampoule designed as field equipment for military field personnel for instant pain reduction. This ampoule contains a powerful dose of salicylic acid. Salicylic acid is known for its ability to ease aches and pains and reduce fevers. These medical properties, particularly fever relief, make it useful as an anti-inflammatory drug. Some researchers believe that salicylate is an essential micronutrient in the human diet, potentially qualifying as a vitamin, namely Vitamin S. Injected into an arm or a thigh.

MRE (1 pack left)

The Meal, Ready-to-Eat (commonly known as the MRE) is a self-contained, individual field ration in lightweight packaging developed by the United States military for its service members for use in combat or other field conditions where organized food facilities are not available. One MRE can be used as one meal. The packaging of an MRE is designed to withstand rough conditions and exposure to the elements. Contains one course (entree) along with a variety of other food and drink items. While it can be eaten cold, it usually tastes much better when heated up with the included Flameless Ration Heater (FRH, a water-activated exothermic reaction device that emits heat).

PFM-1 scatterable anti-personnel mine

PFM-1 (short for ïðîòèâîïåõîòíàÿ ôóãàñíàÿ ìèíà; NATO name: "Green parrot") used to be a standard-issue anti-personnel mine of the Red Army, employed mainly during the Soviet Invasion of Afghanistan. Its widespread utilization during the conflict led to high civilian casualties, especially among children, since randomly scattered mines were often mistaken for toys due to their familiar shape and color. For this reason, the PFM-1 earned a sinister nick-name: "Child killer." Since then, the mine has been replaced by newer models. However, as was the case with a variety of other 'retired' weaponry, a large number of these mines has somehow made its way into the Zone, becoming its primary booby-trap explosive. The mine is highly valued mainly for its functionality, user-friendliness, compact size and low weight, while its main drawback is a relatively small amount of explosive material: its power is often insufficient to kill a heavily armored Stalker with a single blast. For this reason, the mine should be used in combination with other explosive materials and it acts as an igniter. If it is not armed, the mine will not detonate, even when hit with a gun.

Improvised explosive device (based on OG-7V warhead)

Improvised Explosive Device based on OG-7V warhead and parts of a car battery. It looks like it has been carried around for quite some time and could go off any second. Fortunately, the triggering mechanism ensures that it won't unless the explosive is directly hit by a bullet or subjected to other potent physical force. In the Zone, IEDs are quite popular and Zoners use them for a variety of purposes, from gaining access to closed areas to ambushes. They are also often placed next to mines to greatly amplify the explosion's power. IED can be effectively concealed making it unnoticeable to everyone else.

Gas balloon

%c[0,204,0,51]WARNING: Explodes upon impact
 
%c[0,170,170,170]Heavy metal gas balloon impregnated with compatible polymer on the inside for the CO2/02 gas stored and on the outside with Hypalon for weather abrasion and UV resistance. This gas holder balloon is a collapsible, intermediated storage tank for any industrial gas, prior to bottling under pressure. Upon direct gunfire, the cannister may ignite and after a short while a rapid release of a considerable amount of energy may follow causing the surrounding air to expand instantly and resulting in a delayed but powerful explosion with metal shrapnels going in every direction. Unfortunately, such cannisters have been utilized as a weapon in the feuds between factions in the Zone killing many and crippling even more. If emptied, the balloon can be utilized for heavy armor repairs.

Powder can

%c[0,204,0,51]WARNING: Explodes upon impact
 
%c[0,170,170,170]A small and moderately heavy metal can filled with a mixture of explosive industrial chemicals, metal bolts and nuts as well as black gunpowder retrieved from old ammunition. A notorious death trap put together by a group of Russian bandits known as "the Swireksters" and sold to various bandit groups in Zaton and Jupiter. Upon direct gunfire, the can will instantly explode with metal bolts and corrosive chemicals bursting in every direction. No one in their right mind should drop their guard when close to this deadly weapon. You can use the metal parts of the can for emergency maintenance of outfits.

Jerrycan

%c[0,204,0,51]WARNING: Explodes upon impact
 
%c[0,170,170,170]A large (with capacity of about 20 litres), half-emptied metal can with explosive fuel. Jerrycans were brought to the Zone in large quantities by the Ukrainian military for their armored vehicles. Initially, they served their purpose, but after the second Chernobyl Disaster vehicles for reasons still unknown were no longer operational. While some Zoners are still trying to make the wrecks work again, others have found alternate ways of utlizing the jerrycans; namely, as improvised explosives. Upon direct hit, the cannister will catch fire and explode after a slight delay. Although heavy and cumbersome, a full and well placed jerrycan can be lethal even if the target wears the heaviest of body armors. On the other hand, the explosion is often so potent that the killer becomes the victim himself, so it's best to use these cannisters with caution. There are rumors that a veteran Stalker named Yuya once saved his skin by luring a pseudogiant into a jerrycan trap. He emptied his last Makarov magazine and the giant burst into flames with a roar that was heard throughout the Jupiter.
